channel.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
channel.description:
I've been playing around with my classic source for a little while now, and would like to get the server onto a dedicated server. I can't run it from my house, as I can't get the port to open (I've spent more hours than I'd like to admit on it). I just have a couple of questions before I continue anything though.
1) How hard is it to put a RSPS on a dedicated server? Are there any guides? I've tried looking for them, but can't find anything.
2) What is the likelihood of Jagex coming after me if I do get this server online? I will be heavily modifying it, including an entire new map from scratch.
3) As for hosting, from what I saw, I'd be looking at about $100/mo?

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @D.Shark D.Shark
item.description:
@D.Shark wrote:

Just to throw this out there, ‘ddos protection’ offered by a host doesn’t mean shit. When it comes down to it and you’re getting attacked at a size which effects other users on the network, a host like Hostgator is going to drop you in a heartbeat!

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

You can host a RSC Private server for 15 dollars a month without any problems and with Ddos protection… it’s called VPS from HostGator.com and it’s pretty easy you just have to know how to use SSH which is like command prompt on windows but you can’t use windows there at this cheap price so you have to learn how to use the linux operating system.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @ManaPot ManaPot
item.description:
@ManaPot wrote:

Wow, thanks for all of the replies! All great news, can’t wait to get this thing up and running. I’ve had a blast editing the code, really looking forward to creating a new landscape for it. Thanks everyone!

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @Artemis_Wp Artemis Wp
item.description:
@Artemis_Wp wrote:

Theres some VPS providers that gives u free 1GB DDoS protect in package with VPS. So u don’t have to set up the DDoS protection. And u can rent VPS from 24-70$/month depends on which one u like to rent.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

The downside is having to also pay another $100/mo + several hundred for set up of a DDoS protection proxy service if you want your server to withstand the constant DDoS attacks that anyone with $20 can rent for a few hours.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

Configuring a VPS is pretty much exactly the same as a dedicated server. The only difference is that you’re getting dedicated hardware, so none of this bullshit where performance depends on the load on other instances. You also sometimes get fancy stuff like BIOS config over KVM, and other hardware-level stuff… but you’re not going to need that for an RSPS.

I got a pretty sweet dedi for £40/month, but had to pay for a full year. 4GB memory, 2.2GHz dual core. Imo the best part is that you can almost max out a 100mbit connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @Artemis_Wp Artemis Wp
item.description:
@Artemis_Wp wrote:

I have my own RSPS runing right now, so i can tell u …

  1. It’s pretty simple.
  2. They won’t bother for that, as long as they don’t give a f**k on RSC.
  3. Better use a VPS + DDoS protect that will cost you like 70$/mo.

Qestions? Add my msn

Read full topic

item.title: Putting RSPS on Dedicated Server
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

  1. Not very hard. It’s just like configuring your own computer but without any(?) access issues.
  2. Very unlikely. They really don’t even bother with private servers for the most part
  3. For a dedicated server, probably. You could also use a VPS until you actually have a player base that requires a dedi

Read full topic
